Blog.post: urlLink I read an interesting urlLink blog that discusses the relationship between freedom and passion. Isn't it nice to know that there are urlLink people out there thinking about topics like this?? :-) I found his statement that we are "only prisoners of of our past choices" to ring true. You may have noticed that I was also delving into the idea of choice (problem solving) in my last urlLink post . For some reason, it's been on my mind lately. It just seems to me that we all get caught up in a fatalistic view of our lives. We tell ourselves that we can't do this or that, or we "have to" do something, when what we really need is to pick ourselves up by the bootstraps and get in gear. Our own mental wishing and negativity seem to prevent this from happening. Take me, for example. I urlLink whine and moan to myself inside my head. "I should give up urlLink smoking for good." "I should urlLink exercise more." "I should urlLink eat to fuel my body." "I should urlLink date more girls." You get the idea. It boils down to this: You must choose to do it. urlLink Then you do it . Period. So, I mean to pick myself up by the bootstraps and start living my own life. Inspiring, isn't it?? I'll keep you updated on how it's going. Until then, enjoy urlLink this little morsel...

I'm leaving On a jet plane (on Sunday). Don't know when I'll be back again. Actually, I do. I'll be back in a week. I think I can handle a week with the fam-damily. My buddy urlLink James was kind enough to offer to care for urlLink Mr. D. while I'm gone. What can I say? Santiago es la bomba otra vez.

What to do, people? What to do? Little bro's b-day on Sunday... Little sis's college graduation a week from Sunday... but I gotta take care of my dog, and I hate running around on my vacation. Should I just go up for the graduation? Should I go up for the birthday too, and spend a possibly excruciating 10 days in Michigan? Let me know what allsyalls think. And step on it! :-)

The rainy season has finally arrived in beautiful el suroeste de la Florida. Mr. D. wasn't all that happy about it, though. He went to hide in my bathroom and wouldn't even eat his greeny. Poor feller.

Over the intercom while dropping off Shelley and Rachel: Please report all unintended baggage... Indeed. Those pesky baggages! When will they ever learn? Procreating all over the place, making little baggages that the rest of us have to pay for! Oh well. I suppose that's what we get with "abstinence only" education in La Florida!

A word on the topic I'd like to mention When it comes to [hacking Linksys] Whoo! I'm representin'. Foolio neighbors set up a Linxis wireless netwerk somewheres on our strizeet, yo. Running channel 6ix. urlLink Inte__eer_ng w__h ou_ con_____on . The center of the BBH was smack dab on our couch. It was a total eclipse of the Big Dark Cloud. So we changed our channel! What's up now? Punk! I also changed their channel just for fun. If you want to change it, the IP is urlLink 198.162.1.1 . The login is admin and the passphrase is admin. Try to preent stuphs from their preenter, stuphs lyke Stupid Link-sissy! We loathe your channel 6! Stop tormenting my Xtreme G! AAAAAAGHHHHH!

James and I have a theory that most people think of the Internet as a Big Dark Cloud. The original BDC came from the box of our urlLink D-link wireless router , where the urlLink handy set-up diagram showed the computer connection. Oh! The computer bone's connected to the router bone! The router bone's connected to the cable modem bone! The cable modem bone's connected to the - you guessed it - the Notorious B.D.C. bone. :( I thought it would be fun to search Gügel for the BDC (is that a metasearch?), and this is what I came up with. I haven't really read it, but I think he's putting forth a concerted effort to wax comical. Post your r(ants/aves/iots/esidues) and let me know what tú piensas. Also try looking up his new words urlLink potatos and urlLink moreso on Merriam-Webster. You'll find that they don't exist. Unfortunately, what do exist are his comic book collections and critiques of poor UK movies. All in all, I rate it Ph - for Phuglerific. PS Nice beer bottle, Mikey Boy.

Looking to fan your inner flame? Check these tutorials out. You can find Photoshop on urlLink Kazaa Lyte . I can't guarantee this download, but give it a shot anyway. You can find HTML on the urlLink Internet . You can find urlLink Flash if you click your mouse fast enough. Chances are you can find the authorware on K++ también.

This is my buddy James's Blog. Lots of good information on recent happenings in the Dominican Republic. Also lots of good information on why one shouldn't sleep in on a Sunday morning. Santiago es la bomba.

Express true nature! Look inside yourself. The real you is like the sticky-octopus wall crawler you get in your Cap'n Crunch: it's guaranteed to be in the box, but you have to do a lot of chewing to get down to it.

You realize that the one you love very much isn't for you. You walk the brink and you learn to fly, you break free of your Self, you break free of your awful past, you see a new Light. Salsa dancing. Who knew you could dance so well, Casanova? Melding of minds, tippy-tap go the dance steps. Better than you imagined. And when you let loose, nothing but Sky raining down on Earth. As it should be. I am all men. As it will ever be. All mankind from these loins. As it ever was. We saw it coming. Nothing: kissing bliss and a shy raccoon. Life is renewed. Reconciliation without penance. Night.

urlLink You , Now Poet, are my kindred. Make the words/code/volts shine with the moments of your day. Too many go unnoticed. Seek not the answers of others; realize your questions are what you and others are seeking. The seeking is what we all seek . Strange, ¿no? that somehow we recognize our affinity electronically, ¡electronic ally! Speak, SPEAK for those who do not, cannot point to what it is. Be the Dreammaker Sleepraker Soundkeeper Prayerweeper . Intoxicate the bandwidth ∞ .
Once again I am uplifted to find another excellent human on our humble planet! Infinit, you asked what I meant by "Life is about returning." I mean urlLink this .
An excerpt from Whitman's Leaves of Grass ... MEMORIES How sweet the silent backward tracings! The wanderings as in dreams—the meditation of old times resumed—their loves, joys, persons, voyages.

Back home, I keep noticing the smallest details: how thin the blades of grass are; how good the house smells with coffee brewing; the way my Dad grills the tri-tip; how my toilet flushes with just one push. When I went to push down the handle, I think I almost broke it; I'm so used to more resistance! Even with the cooler weather and the grey days, I miss being home.
urlLink On my way to Detroit for Tommy's birthday. I got up late and almost missed my plane. Oops.

The smoker thinks he's the unibomber. The Argentine thinks I'm checking out his wife. The tourist thinks she only has to put sunscreen on half her face. The sideburn boy thinks he can hide his indecision. The menopausal woman thinks the fire extinguisher is a hat. The fat girl thinks she's a ballerina.

Prodigious progeny pumping pain por her piehole. Crooked crevasses cannot contain el cáncer de pulmones. She won't come down. ¡De pulmones se viste el cáncer en la poetisa! ¡De pulmones viene el humo negro para borrar su vida! ¡De pulmones viene la voz que me cuenta sus cantos! Y por eso las maldades de muchos pulmones no me gustan a mí.

The revelation of )(, which was given to him to light the path of peace to his disciples; and was made known through his angel at the Trial to his servant Xenophilus, who testified to the practice, even to all that he IMed. Xenophilus to the seven clubs that are in Europe: Abiding peace and focus from )( that is, was, is to come, isn't, wasn't, and will never be. Look at )( but do not see it; speak )( but do not say it; take )( but do not )(. Glory through non-glory, name that is not Eternal Name, forever and never, Amen. "I am non, I am always not myself," says )(, that is, was, is to come, isn't, wasn't, and will never be. To )( non-glory fornever and ever, Amen. I, Xenophilus, your brother who share with you in )( the State (that is non-state), was on the peninsula called Iberia because of the path of )( and the testimony to )(. I was seated in focus, and I heard behind me a loud voice like a subwoofer saying, "Blog on the Internet what you see and post it for the seven clubs, for Joy-Eslava, Kapital, Ministry, La Habana, Las Caballerizas, Oxígeno, and Yo-yo. Then I turned to see whose voice it was, and on turning I saw seven golden turntables, and in the midst of the turntables I saw one like the DJ of Joy-Eslava, clothed in a black suit with a golden buckle on his belt. His head and his hair were white as a strobe light, white as snow; his eyes were like laser beams, his kicks were like burnished bronze, refined as in a furnace, and his voice was like the sound of Niagara. In his right hand he held seven lit mouth candies, and from his mouth came a mic, and his face was like the spotlight shining with full force. When I saw him, I fell down as if ODed. But he placed his right hand on me, saying, "Fear not! I am the wasn't and the isn't, the is and the was, the maybe. I was unfocused, but now Satori. I have the key to )(. Now blog what you have seen, what may be, and what did take place after what's about to happen. As for the mystery of the seven lit mouth candies that you saw in my right hand, and the seven golden turntables: the seven lit mouth candies are the angels of the seven clubs, and the seven turntables are the seven clubs."

I am a lazy bastard. I confess to you, my brothers and sisters, that I have not blogged through my own fault, in my thoughts and in my (missing) words, in what I have done and what I have failed to do. And I ask the blessed webmaster, ever virgin (he is a computer geek, after all), and you, my brothers and sisters, to pray for me to the Xen our Blog.

urlLink Hey, I know. Let's dive in. Let's scour the world. Let's learn to program Python. Tell me about the Tao of modern society. Computer zen? Go logoff. Let's learn all about syntax, and runtimes, and semantics, and tokens, and variables, and strings. Deep mode. It is not a crime, silly cracker. I'll focus my morning... day... evening. I'm getting calls from upstate, Georgia, Michigan. I'm going high-level. I look down, and all I see is pure putty in my hands. Only it's my will that's doing the talking now, pilgrim. I'm bending spoons.

This night is pregnant with heat. I breathe heavily, ready you for me. _______ Pearl moon, its shape sinks beyond silhouetted pines; your voice still lingers among those branches, reaching up to feel that soft white glow.

urlLink by gay Lennie who says that one of my eyes is smaller than the other, I've been parting my hair on the wrong side, my face is misshapen, I need to wax my eyebrows, and I should consider some eye cream to give my skin more elasticity. At least he says I have a "good swirl" on the back of my head. Incidentally, he puts Preparation H on the bags under his eyes to take the swelling down. But I'll be damned if I've had a better haircut. Marvelous.

These three artists, goateed, immutable, sit in a row - the lines simple, meaning clear, as I take their portrait and they, in silence, draw the lines of others.
